generif.text: Potent mitogenicity of the RET/PTC3 oncogene correlates with its prevalence in tall-cell variant of papillary thyroid carcinoma.
Domain interactions between coregulator ARA(70) and the androgen receptor (AR); structure activity relationship
ARA70 has a role in enhancing the androgen receptor during testicular development
role in reducing agonist activity of antiandrogens
causes increases in nuclear NF-kappaB activity and secretion of MCP-1 and GM-CSF; studies implicate oncogene-induced cytokine-signaling pathways in a new mechanism linking inflammation with cancer

ARA70 was identifed as a coactivator of PPARalpha in the prostate cancer cell line DU145. In the adrenal cell line Y1, ARA70 behaved as a repressor of PPARalpha while still able to coactivate PPARgamma.
The refolding and one-step purification of ARA70 from inclusion bodies over-expressed in Escherichia coli is reported.

ARA70 is a coactivator for estrogen receptor alpha (ERalpha) and may represent a functional link between ERalpha/androgen receptor (AR) modulating their cross-talk in models of estrogen signaling in MCF-7 and HeLa cells

Together, ARA54 and ARA70 modulate vitamin D receptor transactivation, and the competition for ARA70 mediates the suppressive affect of androgen-androgen receptor on vitamin D receptor transactivation.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
a functional interaction between NcoA4 and AhR that may alter AhR activity to affect disease development and progression is demonstrated
Expression of androgen receptor co-regulators in the testes of men with azoospermia.
in prostate cancer cell lines, ARA70beta localized to the cytosol, whereas ARA70alpha was found in the nucleus, supporting the notion of their dissimilar functions
ARA70 beta is a regulator of tumor cell growth and metastasis by affecting gene expression
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)

PTC1 and PTC3 are highly oncogenic proteins when overexpressed, but result in indolent disease compared with RET-related MTCs due to their relatively low expression from the NCOA4 and CCDC6 promoters in vivo.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
Screening for BRAF, RET, KRAS, NRAS, and HRAS mutations, as well as RET-PTC1 and RET-PTC3 rearrangements, was performed on cases of Hashimoto thyroiditis with a dominant nodule
ARA70alpha functions as a tumor suppressor gene
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
Suppression of MSMB expression or NCOA4 overexpression promotes anchorage-independent growth of prostate epithelial cells.
Studies indicate nuclear receptor coactivator 4 (NcoA4) as a coactivator for a variety of nuclear receptors.

Computational network analysis reveals that the MSMB gene is functionally connected to NCOA4 and the androgen receptor signaling pathway. The data provide an example of how GWAS-associated variants may have multiple genetic and epigenetic effects

Data indicate that the increase in prostate cancer (PC) risk associated with rs10993994:C>T is likely mediated by the variant's effect of MSMB-encoded protein PSP94 expression; however, this effect does not extend to NCOA4 in the data.
mechanism dissection shows that KLK2 may cooperate with the AR coregulator, ARA70, to enhance AR transactivation that may result in alteration of prostate cancer formation

identification of NCOA4 as a selective cargo receptor for autophagic turnover of ferritin (ferritinophagy), which is critical for iron homeostasis, and provides a resource for further dissection of autophagosomal cargo-receptor connectivity
NCOA4 acts as a regulator of DNA replication origins that helps prevent inappropriate DNA synthesis and replication stress.
RET/PTC3 gene rearrangements are the most prevalent form of rearrangements in papillary thyroid carcinomas of Chennai population.
provide a new mechanism for selective autophagy of ferritin and reveal a previously unappreciated role for autophagy and NCOA4 in the control of iron homeostasis in vivo
Ubiquitin-dependent NCOA4 turnover is promoted by excess iron and involves an iron-dependent interaction between NCOA4 and the HERC2 ubiquitin ligase.
the ATG5-ATG7-NCOA4 autophagic pathway has a role in ferroptosis

The H-ferritin could bind up to 24 NCOA4(383-522) fragments forming highly stable and insoluble complexes. The binding was partially inhibited only by Fe(II) among the various divalent metal ions analyzed. The iron-dependent, highly-specific formation of the remarkably stable H-ferritin-NCOA4 complex shown in this work may be important for the characterization of the mechanism of ferritinophagy.
Thyroid hormone receptor beta and NCOA4 regulate terminal erythrocyte differentiation.

the actions of PCBP1 and NCOA4 on ferritin allow erythroid cells to rapidly respond to changes in cellular iron availability, which could provide a strategy to maintain cellular iron storage and utilization at a constant rate despite fluctuation in the total cellular iron supply.
NCOA4-RET as the dominant fusion in intercalated duct type salivary gland intraductal carcinoma.
Study showed that NCOA4-mediated ferritin complex degradation supplies iron to mitochondria.
Tumor-type-specific NCOA4-RET or TRIM27-RET translocations are found in a subset of widely invasive salivary carcinomas with intercalated duct-like immunoprofiles.
Thermodynamic and Kinetic Studies of the Interaction of Nuclear Receptor Coactivator-4 (NCOA4) with Human Ferritin.
Ferritinophagy is not required for colon cancer cell growth.
Low expression of ferritinophagy-related NCOA4 gene in relation to unfavorable outcome and defective immune cells infiltration in clear cell renal carcinoma.
Loss of COPZ1 induces NCOA4 mediated autophagy and ferroptosis in glioblastoma cell lines.
NCOA4-mediated ferritinophagy promoted inflammatory responses in periodontitis.
Nuclear receptor coactivator 4-mediated ferritinophagy drives proliferation of dental pulp stem cells in hypoxia.
Intraductal carcinoma of the salivary gland with NCOA4-RET: expanding the morphologic spectrum and an algorithmic diagnostic approach.
The Role of NCOA4-Mediated Ferritinophagy in Ferroptosis.
NCOA4-Mediated Ferroptosis in Bronchial Epithelial Cells Promotes Macrophage M2 Polarization in COPD Emphysema.
TRIM7 modulates NCOA4-mediated ferritinophagy and ferroptosis in glioblastoma cells.
C-MYC Inhibited Ferroptosis and Promoted Immune Evasion in Ovarian Cancer Cells through NCOA4 Mediated Ferritin Autophagy.
The PTBP1NCOA4 axis promotes ferroptosis in liver cancer cells.
JNK-JUN-NCOA4 axis contributes to chondrocyte ferroptosis and aggravates osteoarthritis via ferritinophagy.
RET rearrangements are relevant to histopathologic subtypes and clinicopathological features in Thai papillary thyroid carcinoma patients.
HECW1 induces NCOA4-regulated ferroptosis in glioma through the ubiquitination and degradation of ZNF350.
NCOA4 requires a [3Fe-4S] to sense and maintain the iron homeostasis.

name: nuclear receptor coactivator 4
summary: This gene encodes an androgen receptor coactivator. The encoded protein interacts with the androgen receptor in a ligand-dependent manner to enhance its transcriptional activity. Chromosomal translocations between this gene and the ret tyrosine kinase gene, also located on chromosome 10, have been associated with papillary thyroid carcinoma. Alternatively spliced transcript variants have been described. Pseudogenes are present on chromosomes 4, 5, 10, and 14. [provided by RefSeq, Feb 2009].
